meanings.definition: A harmful or evil mixture or concoction.
meanings.sent1: The witch brewed her hellbroths in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The smell of the foul hellbroths filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The evil sorcerer's hellbroths were so potent, even the trees shivered.
meanings.sent4: The corruption in his heart was like a simmering hellbroths waiting to spill over.
meanings.sent5: The villagers whispered of the cursed well that produced the hellbroths.

meanings.definition: A disgusting or foul liquid or substance.
meanings.sent1: The stagnant pond was a breeding ground for all kinds of hellbroths.
meanings.sent2: The sewer overflowed, releasing a putrid stream of hellbroths.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added a spoonful of hellbroths to the soup, creating chaos in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The toxic waste formed a bubbling cauldron of hellbroths in the abandoned factory.
meanings.sent5: The foul stench of the swamp was like a cloud of noxious hellbroths.
